protection"}],["$","$Lf","13",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/law","children":"law"}],["$","$Lf","14",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/regulation","children":"regulation"}],["$","$Lf","15",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/politics","children":"politics"}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_summary__Zyb4E","children":[["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Proposal:"}]," EU \"Chat Control\" mandates automated scanning of all private digital communications, including text, photos, and files."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Scope:"}]," Affects all 450 million EU citizens; applies to end-to-end encrypted platforms."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Mechanism:"}]," Involves client-side scanning or other methods that weaken or bypass encryption, creating security vulnerabilities."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-3",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Legal Conflict:"}]," Challenges fundamental rights to privacy and data protection under Articles 7 and 8 of the EU Charter."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-4",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Technical Issues:"}]," Automated scanning systems are prone to high rates of false positives, potentially flagging innocent content."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-5",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Precedent:"}]," Establishes a framework for mass surveillance that could be adopted by other governments globally."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-6",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Exemptions:"}]," EU politicians are excluded from this surveillance under \"professional secrecy\" rules."]}],"\n"]}]]}]]}],["$","div","1",{"className":"ArticlePreview_ArticlePreview__59E_4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_title__Snpua","children":["$","$Lf",null,{"href":"https://wikimediafoundation.org/news/2025/08/11/wikimedia-foundation-challenges-uk-online-safety-act-regulations/","target":"_blank","children":"Wikimedia Foundation Challenges UK Online Safety Act Regulations"}]}],"$L10","$L11"]}],"$L12"]}]}]]}]
10:["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_tags__y8wnE","children":[["$","$Lf","0",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/wikipedia","children":"wikipedia"}],["$","$Lf","1",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/wikimedia%20foundation","children":"wikimedia foundation"}],["$","$Lf","2",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/uk","children":"uk"}],["$","$Lf","3",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/online%20safety%20act","children":"online safety act"}],["$","$Lf","4",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/ofcom","children":"ofcom"}],["$","$Lf","5",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/regulation","children":"regulation"}],["$","$Lf","6",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/law","children":"law"}],["$","$Lf","7",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/legal","children":"legal"}],["$","$Lf","8",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/identity%20verification","children":"identity verification"}],["$","$Lf","9",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/privacy","children":"privacy"}],["$","$Lf","10",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/safety","children":"safety"}],["$","$Lf","11",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/human%20rights","children":"human rights"}],["$","$Lf","12",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/legal%20challenge","children":"legal challenge"}]]}]
11:["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_summary__Zyb4E","children":[["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Subject:"}]," Wikimedia Foundation's legal challenge to the UK's Online Safety Act (OSA) ",["$","strong","strong-1",{"children":"Categorisation Regulations"}],"."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Core Issue:"}]," The regulations risk assigning Wikipedia \"Category 1\" status, imposing the most stringent OSA duties, which include mandatory identity verification for many contributors."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Claimant's Argument:"}],"\n",["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":"Category 1 duties are designed for high-risk commercial platforms, not non-profit, volunteer-moderated projects like Wikipedia."}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":"Identity verification would undermine contributor privacy and safety, potentially exposing them to harassment, lawsuits, or state-level persecution."}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":"Compliance would divert critical resources and expose the platform to increased vandalism and manipulation."}],"\n"]}],"\n"]}],"\n",["$","li","li-3",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Legal Status & Outcome:"}],"\n",["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":"The High Court of Justice heard the case on July 22-23, 2025."}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":["On August 11, 2025, the court ",["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"dismissed"}]," the Foundation's challenge."]}],"\n"]}],"\n"]}],"\n",["$","li","li-4",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Judicial Guidance:"}],"\n",["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":"The ruling is not a \"green light\" for the regulator (Ofcom) to implement the OSA in a way that harms Wikipedia."}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":"The court acknowledged Wikipedia's value and the potential human rights impact on its volunteers."}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":"The judge suggested Ofcom may require a \"particularly flexible interpretation\" of the rules, or that parliamentary amendment may be necessary to protect Wikipedia."}],"\n"]}],"\n"]}],"\n",["$","li","li-5",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Next Step:"}]," First categorization decisions by Ofcom are expected in Summer 2025."]}],"\n"]}]]}]
12:["$","div","2",{"className":"ArticlePreview_ArticlePreview__59E_4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_title__Snpua","children":["$","$Lf",null,{"href":"https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cjr11qqvvwlo","target":"_blank","children":"Wikipedia loses challenge against Online Safety Act verification rules"}]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_tags__y8wnE","children":[["$","$Lf","0",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/wikipedia","children":"wikipedia"}],["$","$Lf","1",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/online%20safety%20act","children":"online safety act"}],["$","$Lf","2",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/uk","children":"uk"}],["$","$Lf","3",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/law","children":"law"}],["$","$Lf","4",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/legal","children":"legal"}],["$","$Lf","5",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/regulation","children":"regulation"}],["$","$Lf","6",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/privacy","children":"privacy"}],["$","$Lf","7",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/identity%20verification","children":"identity verification"}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_summary__Zyb4E","children":[["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Legal Action:"}]," The Wikimedia Foundation lost a judicial review challenging the UK's Online Safety Act regulations."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Core Conflict:"}]," Wikimedia argued that the act's \"Category 1\" classification, intended for large social media sites, was too broad and improperly applied to Wikipedia."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Primary Concern:"}]," If classified as \"Category 1,\" Wikipedia might be forced to implement identity verification for its contributors, which it claims would undermine the privacy and safety of its volunteer editors."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-3",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Court's Ruling:"}]," The High Court dismissed the challenge to the lawfulness of the government's decision-making process for the regulations."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-4",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Future Implications:"}]," The judgment leaves open the possibility for future legal challenges, specifically against Ofcom's potential decision to classify Wikipedia as \"Category 1\" or if the act's implementation makes the site's operation unviable."]}],"\n"]}]]}]]}]
